alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 07 at 5:41PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...AN APPROACHING TROPICAL CYCLONE WILL BRING STRONG WINDS, HEAVY RAINFALL, AND HAZARDOUS SEAS AND SURF TO THE MARIANAS NEXT WEEK... A strengthening tropical cyclone, currently Tropical Depression 15W, will approach and likely pass through the Marianas Tuesday and Wednesday. TD 15W is forecast to become a tropical storm by Sunday, with further strengthening expected. This is a developing situation, but the forecast "cone" is starting to narrow and a passage through or very near the Mariana Islands expected, with a passage near or over Guam or Rota being favored Tuesday into Wednesday. As of now, tropical storm force winds for most or all of the islands is forecast, with low-end typhoon winds possible close to the eye of the storm passage. Forecast track and storm wind intensity will continue to be narrowed down and fine-tuned as the storm approaches. What is of more certainty is that heavy rainfall and hazardous seas and surf will accompany this system. Current estimates are for 6 to 10 inches of rain to fall between Monday night and Wednesday afternoon, with locally higher amounts near 12 inches possible. Hazardous seas and and surf look likely to begin Monday night, with highs seas and high surf expected Tuesday and Wednesday.
